intro: Xerochrysum gudang, commonly known as the golden weed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a low-growing habit with narrow, hairy leaves. Xerochrysum gudang is adapted to arid conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
